definition: To reverse the direction or orientation of something, often by turning it around completely. This word is commonly used to describe the action of physically flipping or rotating an object, but it can also be used metaphorically to convey the idea of changing the course or outcome of a situation.

examples.german: Er hat sich umgedreht und ist gegangen.
Ich habe mich im Kreis umgedreht.
examples.english: I turned around in a circle.

examples.german: Sie drehte den Schlüssel um und öffnete die Tür.
examples.english: She turned the key and opened the door.

examples.german: Der Wind hat die Blätter umgedreht.
